title: Sports Marketing/Analytics
text:
I want to utilize my skills that I have learned to develop analytics to determine who may be useful to a team and what the team can use to maximize there profits. This would be done by utlizing my skills in excel to determine such things like demographics, ages, and location. Doing this I can learn what the team needs to advertise and they can use to bring more fans to there games.
Using my skills in Rstudio and also Python I am able to produce websites and informative presentations to show my finding and make them readable. I am able to transfer excel sheets into Rstudio and by doing that I am able to wrangle important data and determine the answers that are needed.

title: Sports Marketing/Analytics
text:
How can I be Utilized

Sports Analysis: Evaluating the preformance of players statistics.
Data Visualization: Turning raw datasets into charts or plots.
Fan Evaluation: Exploring what fans like and want to maximize profits.
Customer & Market Insights: Using analytics to better understand user behavior and optimize experiences.

title: Data Wrangling/Visualization and Rsdtudio
text: Below is a project/assigment I did for my CIS3100 class. This illustrates my skills in data wrangling and in visualization. Through this you can see what codes I used to wrangle said data. You can also see my graphs and charts that I have also created to correlate with the data that i have wrangled.

title: Data Wrangling/Visualization and Rsdtudio
text:
[Project Title: M05-Application-Data_Wrangling_Tidyverse]
For my class I had too answer many challenging questions. This included the questions about wrangling certain data from datasets. I also had to create charts and graphs to visual the data that i have wrangled. You can also see in majority of the questions I have added different kinds of graphs and charts. You can see that I have made numbers or words on the y and x axis and I made it so they have multiple color indicators as well as otehr useful things.
Skills Demonstrated:

Data Wrangling: Took data from datasets and layed out the data that was needed.
Visualization: Turned that data into visual charts and graphs.
Customization: I made color indicators and added legends to the graphs and charts.
Use of Ggplot2: Used the package ggplot to develop my graphs and charts.

Below is an embedded demonstration of the interactive report:

title: Covid-19 Preventive Protocols
text:
Overview
This project involved building a presentation using Rstudio. Through this I wrangled data, specifically data that talked about the ways coffee shops prevented the spread of covid 19. I then created box plots and bar charts to visual the data that was found to make it easier for an audience to read and understand.
Github for this project: Click here




Learning Outcomes

Wrangling specific data from datasets
Visualizing the data that was wrangled
Building a presentation through Rstudio

Communicating what was found through methods and visualization

Learning how to push and pull in Github




Key Skills Gained

Visualization

Github pushing, pulling, and committing
Data wrangling in R

R Shiny visualization

GGplot2 visualization
